span.p:
Dear Tallmadge Parents and Guardians,
This afternoon, Governor Mike DeWine made the decision to close Ohioâs school buildings for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year due to continued concerns over the spread of COVID-19 (coronavirus). As the health, safety and well-being of our students is our top priority, we support the Governorâs decision but are saddened students will not be returning to district buildings. Â The Tallmadge City School District will continue to provide remote learning for students through the remainder of the school year.
We realize the stress that this puts on our families and Â community during this already difficult time; and are working diligently to continue to provide resources. Please use the Covid-19 Info Menu on our website for more information.
In addition to online learning, we want to assure everyone that mental health resources are, and will continue to be, available during this time. We have outlined these resources in addition to information on contacting school counselors on our website.
In the coming days and weeks, we will continue to provide regular updates, district news and communications as necessary. While we are truly saddened by the fact that we will not be finishing the remainder of the school year in person, we are all in this together and will overcome any obstacle during this unprecedented time.
Tallmadge Strong
#InThisTogether
Jeffrey M. Ferguson
Superintendent
